title: ICE: type metadata for unique ID `VariantStructType([async block@h3/src/tests/connection.rs:631:22: 646:6], 0, HiddenZst)` is already in the `TypeMap`!

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code The error occurs when compiling tests in https://github.com/hyperium/h3. I am sorry but I wasn't able to create a minimized example. But I found out that without this function call (and the same function calls in similar tests) the error don't occur. https://github.com/hyperium/h3/blob/885144bfcb0414bcb86b63cec9c65a611c7e56ee/h3/src/tests/connection.rs#L586 . ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0-beta.2 (352eb59a4 2022-12-13) binary: rustc commit-hash: 352eb59a4c33abf739914422f2ad975925750146 commit-date: 2022-12-13 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.0-beta.2 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm/src/debuginfo/metadata/type_map.rs:133:13: type metadata for unique ID 'VariantStructType([async block@h3/src/tests/connection.rs:631:22: 646:6], 0, HiddenZst)' is already in the `TypeMap`! ```
Backtrace
